samples.name: Default Functionalities
samples.description: The Document Editor component is used to create, edit, view, and print Word documents in web applications.

samples.name: Character Formatting
samples.description: The Document Editor supports character formatting such as bold, italic, underline, subscript, superscript, font color, and more.

samples.name: Paragraph Formatting
samples.description: The Document Editor supports paragraph formatting such as indentation, paragraph spacing, line spacing, and text alignment.

samples.name: Styles
samples.description: The Document Editor supports both built-in and custom styles for character format and paragraph format.

samples.name: Bullets and Numbering
samples.description: The Document Editor supports bullets and numbering. Both single list and multi-level lists can be added.

samples.name: Hyperlinks and Bookmarks
samples.description: The Document Editor supports hyperlinks and bookmarks. The link can be a file, mail, webpage, or bookmark.

samples.name: Table Formatting
samples.description: The Document Editor supports table formatting such as cell margins, cell spacing, horizontal merge, vertical merge, border styles, background color, and more.

samples.name: Section Formatting
samples.description: The Document Editor supports section formatting such as page size, page margins, header distance and footer distance.

samples.name: Headers and Footers
samples.description: The Document Editor supports headers and footers. Different headers and footers can be added to the first page, odd pages, and even pages.

samples.name: Table of Contents
samples.description: The Document Editor supports table of contents with options for including hyperlink, page number, right-aligned tabs, and styles.

samples.name: Form Fields
samples.description: The Document Editor component in JavaScript platform allows users to design and fill legacy form fields (text, check box, and drop down) in a Word document.

samples.name: Multiple Columns
samples.description: The Document Editor component is used to allows users to display the text in multiple-column layout like a newspaper.

samples.name: Print
samples.description: The Document Editor component is used to view and print Word documents in web applications by injecting only the modules that are necessary.

samples.name: Right To Left
samples.description: The Document Editor supports right to left for users who use right-to-left languages (Arabic, Hebrew, Urdu, etc.) in Vue platform.

samples.name: Custom Context Menu
samples.description: The Document Editor supports custom options for users who use to add custom options in context menu.

samples.name: Auto Save
samples.description: The Document Editor supports auto save functionality to let the users for saving the documents automatically at customized time interval.

samples.name: Toolbar Customization
samples.description: The Document Editor component supports to show or hide existing items in the toolbar.

samples.name: Chart Preservation
samples.description: The Document Editor supports chart preservation for users who use to view their business reports with intuitive graphical data visualization.

samples.name: Document Protection
samples.description: The Document Editor provides document protection supports to restrict the types of changes can be made to the document by a user/user group.

samples.name: Web Layout
samples.description: The Document Editor component supports the continuous layout type to display the document in a single page.

samples.name: Comments
samples.description: The Document Editor component supports add and edit comments in a Word document for a comment discussion.

samples.name: Track Changes
samples.description: The Document Editor component in JavaScript platform allows users to view, make changes and accept or reject them in a Word document.

samples.name: Mail Merge
samples.description: The Document Editor component provides support to mail merge document with the help of Syncfusion DocIO.

samples.name: Footnotes and Endnotes
samples.description: The DocumentEditor provides support to insert footnotes and endnotes to provide more information about something in the document.
